address: Our company designs and fabricates architectural metal for a variety of jobs. We are looking for experienced and motivated people to begin work immediately here at Phoenix Metal Designs.
We are looking to hire a talented Architectural Drafter with a minimum of 5-years experience for a full-time position.
An ideal candidate can perform the following tasks:
Analyze building codes, by-laws, space, site requirements, technical documents and reports to determine their effect on architectural designs.
Check dimensions of materials to be used and assign numbers to lists of materials.
Have proficiency in AutoCad and AutoDesk Inventor.
Make accurate shop drawings to be used for in-house fabrication.
Work well and coordinate with floor manager to oversee proper fabrication of materials.
Communicate with team members and clients throughout development of projects.
Note: Day to day projects may vary widely: flexibility and the ability to adapt quickly are required.
Regular job hours are 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM Monday through Friday.
Work will be required both in shop and in the field.
Compensation: TBD on Experience and Position
Required is NYS RA or PE, (EIT considered)
You may come from any structural, mechanical, architectural or any other relevant PE or RA sub discipline.

We are a small-mid sized Professional Corp., located in LONG ISLAND CITY, Queens, we provide contractor support for a wide range of NYC DOB required submissions (EQ, DM, SOE, STRUCTURAL STABILITY), as well as architectural, egress, zoning and filing submissions.

-Our contractor support design engineering firm is in need of a FIELD ORIENTED NYS RA or PE for afternoon and evening work, TYPICAL DAY varies from 9-5 to noon-8PM. Due to the reality that the majority of our NYC School Construction Authority contractor clients typically work afternoon/evening shift, we are in search of a field oriented PE/RA to attend scaffold, sidewalk shed, shoring inspections during stated hours.

-You will also be asked to attend SCA and DOB plan exams when inspections not scheduled, as well as responding to objections from plan exams. On days without field work, hours can be 9-5 or 8-4. Flexibility required, employee preference considered.
Required is a valid NYS RA or PE license.
Required is an ability to represent well and communicate well with professionals and nonprofessionals.
Required is an ability to visualize load paths for all components and connections.
Required is an ability to quickly get report data to our central office, and out to clients.
Required is an ability to efficiently climb ladders and scaffold.

You will be commuting all over the 5 boroughs, efficiently routed with the help of our scheduler. The use of subway, citibike, as well as car travel (private or Car-to-go) is strongly encouraged, required for time management in our congested city. Valid drivers license is preferred.
You will not be required to perform heavy calculations or design services, but, this ability is a plus.
You do not need shed or scaffold inspection experience, as you will receive training as necessary from our principal PE.
You will need to become intimate with NYC building code chapter 33, as well as many other relevant sections, if not already familiar.
You do not need autocad experience, but also is a strong plus.
This position can be filled by an RA or PE with any amount of years of experience.
WE ARE OPEN TO CONSIDERING HARD WORKING APPLICANTS WITH MORE EXPERIENCE, AND WILL COMPENSATE ACCORDINGLY.
Even though the work hours are swing shift, this is a 40+- hour week job offer, not a consultancy structure.

As well as competitive salaries, we offer employer contribution in health/dental care, 401k matching saving plan, weekly employer sponsored team building lunch, in-house continuing ed (as part of our IAS accredidation), and basically an all around fun time producing and inspecting serious highly respected products!
For consideration: Please provide resume which shows work history and job durations.
In cover letter, please state your salary range requirements, and anything you would like us to know about why you think you are a good candidate.
Please include resume in body of email or as pdf. Please do not send word docs.
Good Luck in your job search!

, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
